body.p:
To his excellincy
The Govenor of Kentucky

We the undersigned officers and Jury by whom James T. Howard was tried and fined the Sum of fifteen dollars for a breach of the peace pray your Excellency to remit the same said Howard being a very poor man and the offence having been committed from the impulse of the moment without time to reflect, and having been provoked to do the same by Rebel Sympathizers he being a true loyal citizen, yet under the laws of Ky we were bound to inflict the fine which we pray you to remit your memorialists will ever pray &c
Sept 1863

J. B. Elmore forman of the jury
J. L. Watkins
David Carby
William J Snyder
B. F. Wheeler J.R.G.C
John Dennis
George W. Clemmans
James Alveys
J M. Alvey

We the undersigned certify that Jas. T. Howard is a loyal citizen and a member of a home Guard company and that those with whom he had the dificulty refered to by the officers and Jury on the first page are Rebel Sympathisers
Sept. 1863

W. E. Wortham Capt.
Rock cr. home Guard
Martin Miller
